experiment: F-CON3 constitution monitor — data point 5 of 5

methodology.description: Run f_con3_constitution_monitor.py --save at session start, --check after concurrent sessions have committed. Measure: constitutional file hash stability, false positive rate.

frontier_verdict.answer: Yes, immune-response detection works. FP rate 0% (n=5). TP rate 100% (n=1). Detection latency = end-of-session. Tool is production-ready for A1 constitutional mutation monitoring.
frontier_verdict.classification_gap: Sanctioned vs malicious changes require manual review (no automated heuristic). This is acceptable — constitutional changes are rare (1/5 sessions) and always warrant human review.
frontier_verdict.remaining_work: None. Monitor could be wired into pre-commit hook for real-time detection (latency improvement from per-session to per-commit), but this is an optimization, not a requirement.
